title: Relates to limits of the amount of contracts for printing public documents which may be let without competitive bidding
summary: Amends the limits of the amount of contracts for printing public documents which may be let without competitive bidding to match those set forth in the state finance law for purchasing services and commodities.
lawSection: New York State Printing and Public Documents Law

       Introduced  by M. of A. TEDISCO -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend the New York state printing and public documents law, in
         relation to the letting of contracts for printing

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 5 of section 3 of the New York state printing
    2  and public documents law, as amended by chapter 346 of the laws of 1991,
    3  is amended to read as follows:
    4    5. Notwithstanding any of the foregoing provisions of this section, or
    5  of any general or special act, the commissioner AND OTHER STATE AGENCIES
    6  AND DEPARTMENTS may contract for printing to  an  amount  not  exceeding
    7  [ten  thousand  dollars]  THE  LIMIT SET FOR THE COMMISSIONER OF GENERAL
    8  SERVICES AND STATE AGENCIES, RESPECTIVELY, PURSUANT TO  SUBDIVISION  SIX
    9  OF  SECTION  ONE  HUNDRED  SIXTY-THREE  OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW without
   10  competitive bidding[, and  may  by  rule  prescribing  the  amount,  not
   11  exceeding  five  thousand dollars, authorize other state departments and
   12  agencies to let contracts, without  competitive  bidding,  for  printing
   13  required by them. Such rule]. THE COMMISSIONER shall prescribe the form,
   14  manner and content of the notice to be given to prospective vendors, the
   15  form  of  specifications and proposals for such printing, and the method
   16  used in making an award WITHOUT COMPETITIVE  BIDDING  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   17  SUBDIVISION,  except  that  as  such  specifications relate to the paper
   18  required for printing they shall be in accordance with those established
   19  pursuant to section one hundred [sixty-four]  SIXTY-FIVE  of  the  state
   20  finance law.
   21    Multiple  purchases  of  identical  items  of  printing  and  printing
   22  supplies, made by such other department or  agency  without  competitive
   23  bidding within a period of sixty days, shall not exceed the [sum of five
   24  thousand  dollars]  LIMIT SET FOR STATE AGENCIES PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION
   25  SIX OF SECTION ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-THREE OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   26    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
